content.question: Cylindrical containers <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math> hold samples of the same monatomic ideal gas. The gas pressure is the same in all three containers. The areas of the tops of the containers and the temperature of the gas in the containers is indicated in the figure. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="F sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="F sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>, and <math alttext="F sub Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub></math>, the forces exerted by the gas on the tops of containers <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Z</mi></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="F sub Z is greater than F sub Y, which is greater than F sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="F sub Y is greater than, open parenthesis, F sub X equals F sub Z, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub Y equals F sub Z, close parenthesis, is greater than F sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, F sub X equals F sub Z, close parenthesis, is greater than F sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="F sub Y is greater than, open parenthesis, F sub X equals F sub Z, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>Z</mtext></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
